page.title: 06Education in the Alford area
page.content: Each of the three parishes has its own primary school. Only Tullynessle School lies in the survey area. Older children attend Alford Academy - a full six year secondary school. Present rolls are Tullynessle 30, Keig 22, Alford 183, Alford Academy 480. The Education Act of 1980 enabled parents to send their children to the school of their choice. This right has been widely excercised. A variety of vocational and non-vocational evening classes are held in the schools and Community Centre. An Information Tech- nology Centre at Alford Academy will open in 1985 for community use. In an effort to get an independent pay review Scottish teachers are taking escalating industrial action - strikes, cancellation of extra_ curricular activities and recently voting to boycott external exams.
